Three men came to London _ holidays. They came to a very large hotel   and lived in a room on the forty-fifth floor.
One day they went to see a film and walked back to the hotel very late.
"I'm very sorry," said the waiter of the hotel, "But our lift does not work tonight."
One of them said to his two friends, "We have to walk up to our room. It's very _ . I think I know how to make it easier. _ our way to the room, I will _ you some jokes;
then you, John, will sing us a few songs; then you. Peter, will tell us some _ stories. "
So they began to walk to their room. Tom told them many jokes. John _ some songs.
At last they came to the fortieth floor. They were tired and decided to have a rest.
"Well," said Tom, "Peter, will you tell us a true story with a sad end"
"I shall tell you a sad story. " said Peter. "It is short but it is sad enough . We left our key in the downstairs room just now. What shall we do?"
